alert.note: Alert for Frenchman Basin (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 19 at 2:44AM CDT until October 19 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS EXPECTED IN FAR SW NEBRASKA THIS AFTERNOON... .A combination of warm temperatures, low relative humidity and gusty northwesterly winds, will lead to critical fire weather conditions this afternoon in far southwestern Nebraska. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FAR SOUTHWESTERN NEBRASKA... The National Weather Service in North Platte has issued a Red Flag Warning for low relative humidity and gusty winds, which is in effect from 1 PM this afternoon to 7 PM CDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 210 Frenchman Basin. * TIMING...From noon to 6 pm MDT. * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 70s. * IMPACTS...Any fires which may develop have a high probability to spread rapidly and be difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
